Dear [Daughter's Name],

Your letter arrived like a thunderclap on an otherwise quiet day. It's either you're here with us again, or you're not. There is no middle ground in my heart anymore.

I remember our last conversation as vividly as if it were yesterday. You were either angry or sad then too, I suppose. I couldn't understand why you'd say such things to me, your father who loved you more than life itself. It was either black or white for me back then - love or hate, right or wrong.

The years have passed like a blur since that day. Your mother and I, we've been in this house, alone with our memories of you. You're either present in every corner of this place, haunting us with your absence, or you're not here at all, leaving an emptiness that's impossible to fill.

Your forgiveness means everything to me now. It's like the sun breaking through clouds after a storm. But it also feels like a judgement, a verdict delivered without a chance for defense. I never meant to hurt you, child. That's why I left, not because I didn't care.

I hope this letter finds you well. Please know that there is no either-or when it comes to my love for you. It's constant, unyielding, and always here waiting for you, just like our home.

Your loving father,
[Father's Name]
